scream was released on december 20th
1996 at a time when the slasher genre
was riddled with directed video features
and lackluster sequels i mean john
carpenter's halloween was already on its
fifth installment and nightmare on elm
street was on its sixth so needless to
say it was time to shake things up and
here's where screenwriter kevin
williamson enters frame you've probably
heard of his creations dawson's creek
the vampire diaries and the following
but prior to scream williamson was just
a fledgling writer in need of a
compelling story and a stroke of luck
the turning point would occur on march 9
1994 when a news magazine called turning
point
aired an episode on serial killer danny
rowling rowling had viciously murdered
five college students in gainesville
florida back in 1990 and was now facing
the death penalty williamson deeply
inspired by this episode birth to script
entitled scary movie the plot follows a
young group of students well-versed in
classic horror films whose small town is
shaken up by a sudden string of murders
at the hands of a masked assailant aka
ghostface though williamson took
inspiration from rowling's murders it's
important to note how unique his overall
concept was by having his characters
openly discuss and play out horror film
tropes he avoided being cliche himself
and created a meta genre-bending
statement unlike anything that had been
seen before lose the outfit if sydney
says it she'll flip

dimension television and mtv production
development teamed up to produce scream
the tv series which originally aired on
mtv june 30th 2015. the show was first
developed by jill bloatvogel and
followed a string of murders that had
taken place in the fictional town of
lakewood it starred willa fitzgerald
john carner bex taylor laos and many
others this is probably a good time to
discuss the complicated history of the
ghostface mask as it was a source of
contention in the making of the series
the ghostface mask that we've all grown
to love and fear was actually created by
a new york-based company called fun
world back in 1991. craven and marianne
madeline happened to stumble upon the
mask while location scouting for the
first scream and they felt it was the
perfect costume for their slasher film
and when it comes to creating a villain
you just don't question craven

since fun world owned the design craven

was decided that nothing was suitable so
craven convinced the studio to license
the fun world mask for use in scream fun
fact because shooting had already

moulds and not the fun world version but
aside from that ghostface's face stayed
true for the rest of the franchise that
is until the tv series decided to switch

all the scream films don't mess with

three seasons 30 episodes and received
